title: nbis-course-quarto extension
text:
This document showcases the nbis-course-quarto extension. The extension provides two formats, nbis-course-html for html documents, and nbis-course-revealjs for revealjs presentations. The formats are tailored for creating NBIS course web pages and presentation, and provide some custom formatting elements. Wherever custom colors are used, they follow the SciLifeLab visual identity guidelines.
For an example of the nbis-course-revealjs format in action, see the example presentation.


The code is inspired by and draws from the Cambridge bioinformatics training quarto course template.



To use the html format, simply add to the document yaml header
---
format: nbis-course-html
---



Quarto provides callout blocks for highlighting topics of interest. The NBIS-course extension adds three additional callout blocks for exercise content.
All blocks are formatted as fenced divs, with the syntax
:::{.callout-NAME}

This is a special callout block.

:::
where NAME is one of exercise, answer, and hint. By default, exercise is rendered unfolded, whereas the other blocks are rendered folded.


The blocks can be rendered separately or nested within one another. The following example demonstrates the latter case:

:::{.callout-exercise}

The `ls` command is used to list the contents of a directory. What
option provides a so-called long listing format?

:::{.callout-hint}

Type `ls --help` to show the options to `ls`.

:::

:::{.callout-answer}

The `-l` option uses the long listing format, i.e., the command to use
is `ls -l`.

:::

:::






Exercise







The ls command is used to list the contents of a directory. What option provides a so-called long listing format?






Hint







Type ls --help to show the options to ls.











Answer







The -l option uses the long listing format, i.e., the command to use is ls -l.

title: nbis-course-revealjs example
text:
Usage
This presentation uses the following document yaml header:
---
title: "nbis-course-revealjs example"
subtitle: How to write a revealjs presentation
footer: NBIS course
author: John Doe
institute: NBIS
date: today
format: nbis-course-revealjs
---

title: nbis-course-revealjs example
text:
Home icon plugin
The extensions provides a home icon that by default is placed in the bottom left corner of each slide, next to the menu. The exact position can be configured via the position key. The home icon is a customizable link that could point to, e.g., the course home page.
The plugin can be activated and customized by adding the following to the document yaml header:
format:
  nbis-course-revealjs:
    nbishome:
      url: https://nbis.se
      position:
        left: 100px
        bottom: 10px
revealjs-plugins:
  - nbishome

title: nbis-course-revealjs example
text:
Underlined titles
Various different title formats are supported. For instance, the ultitle used here produces titles underlined with a green bar.
format:
  nbis-course-revealjs:
    ultitle: true

title: nbis-course-revealjs example
text:
Title and slide logos
By default, a logo is added to the title page by making use of title-slide-attributes. However, this prevent correct embedding of resources. In order to generate slides with embedded resources, you can set the nbistitlelogo key:
format:
  nbis-course-revealjs:
    nbistitlelogo: false
If you want to omit the logo in the footer, you can unset the standard logo key:
format:
  nbis-course-revealjs:
    logo: ""

title: nbis-course-revealjs example
text:
Color customizations
Colors follow the SciLifeLab visual identity guidelines. Theme colors are used to colorize elements, including:

strong
blockquotes

This is a quote

code

import numpy as np

links: nbis





NBIS course
